title: Study Explores Nutritional Value of Hemp Roots, Microgreens, and Leaves
summary: Australian researchers analyzed hemp leaves, roots and microgreens to determine their nutritional properties.

title: Scientists Link Novel Cell Types to Multiple Sclerosis
summary: Multiple sclerosis (MS) is an autoimmune condition in which the protective insulation surrounding nerve fibers is damaged.

title: Cells Linked to Depression are Discovered
summary: Depression is thought to affect over 250 million people around the world. It is a condition that is difficult to treat because its causes are not well understood.

title: Study Shows Pupil Size Is Not a Reliable Indicator of Acute Cannabis Exposure
summary: A study published in the Clinical Toxicology examined ocular measures as evidence of cannabis-induced impairment and found that pupil size is not a reliable indicator.

title: 40% Fatal Vehicle Crashes Test Positive for THC
summary: Over 40% of drivers who died in motor vehicle collisions tested positive for delta-9-tetrahydrocannabinol (THC) in Ohio's most recent year of data.

title: New Pill May Control High Blood Pressure
summary: A new medication may help patients who have high blood pressure and kidney disease.

title: Ultra-processed Foods May Not Drive Overeating
summary: Your perception of foods may matter as much as their nutritional content in determining whether you'll overeat.

title: New Cannabis Compound Shows Potent Skin Benefits
summary: How can cannabis compounds be used to improve skin health? This is what a recent study published in the Journal of Natural Products hopes to address.

title: Can Chewing Gum Diagnose or Prevent Viral Illness?
summary: Researchers explore the potential of chewing gum in diagnosing and preventing viral illnesses.

title: Researchers Reveal Autoimmune Response in Patients with ALS
summary: A new study reveals an autoimmune response in patients with ALS, shedding light on the disease's progression.

title: Anthony LeTa MD, PhD Appointed Director of National Cancer Institute
summary: Dr. Anthony LeTa has been appointed as the new director of the National Cancer Institute.

title: Growing Role of Ancient Viruses in Human Development Revealed
summary: Scientists have discovered that ancient viruses play a significant role in human development

title: Novel Antibody Neutralizes Wide Range of HIV Variants
summary: Researchers have developed a novel antibody that can neutralize a wide range of HIV variants

title: GLP-1 Inhibitors Reduce Cancer Risk
summary: A new study has found that GLP-1 inhibitors can reduce the risk of cancer

title: Three Immunologists Awarded the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for Breakthrough in Peripheral Immune Tolerance
summary: The Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine is the highest honor bestowed on a scientist concerning their research. The main focus of this year's award is on the breakthrough in peripheral immune tolerance.

title: Asthma and COPD Inhalers Linked to 2 Million Tons of CO₂ Annually
summary: How can inhalers contribute to greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions? This is what a recent study published in JAMA hopes to address.

title: Poor Sleep Linked to Faster Brain Aging
summary: Poor sleep may speed up brain aging, found a new study published in eBioMedicine.

title: Lymph Nodes Facilitate Cancer-Killing Immune Cells
summary: Lymph nodes play a pivotal role in immunity, including anti-tumor responses. Researchers have found that lymph nodes can facilitate cancer-killing immune cells.

title: A Cysteine-Rich Diet is Shown to Boost Intestinal Regeneration
summary: A new study reported in Nature has determined that the amino acid cysteine could promote regeneration among cells in the intestine.

title: American Association of Immunologists Created an Open Science Forum for the Public
summary: The continual release of new apps and platforms that make use of artificial intelligence (AI) has had positive impacts on various fields, including science.

title: Immune Aging May Drive Arthritis
summary: Rheumatoid arthritis is an autoimmune disorder that causes inflammation, swelling and pain in joints.

title: FDA Approves Injectable Immunotherapy Drug
summary: Cancer immunotherapies, anti-cancer treatments that target a patient’s own immune system, working to make it more effective at fighting cancer.

title: Novel Biomarkers Revealed in Pediatric Germ Tumors
summary: Although pediatric cancer is rare, it is the leading cause of death by disease in children, according to the National Institute of Health.

title: Combination Therapy Overcomes Glioblastoma Resistance
summary: Glioblastoma is the most common and aggressive form of brain cancer in adults. There are about 12,000 new cases diagnosed every year in the United States.

title: Electric Fields and Fluoxetine Delivery Accelerate Healing
summary: How can machine learning be used to treat and heal wounds? This is what a recent study published in npj Biomedical Engineering explored.

title: How Death Fold Domains Boost Immune Protection
summary: The immune system can be a double-edged sword; we need it to protect us from pathogens and aberrant cells, but if it is overactive, it can lead to autoimmune diseases.

title: Anthony Letai, MD, PhD, Appointed Director of National Cancer Institute
summary: Dr. Anthony Letai has been appointed as the new director of the National Cancer Institute.

title: Scientists Reveal Nanoplastics Dysregulate Brain Cells
summary: Researchers have discovered that nanoplastics can dysregulate brain cells.

title: CBD Shows Promise in Treating Skin Cancers and Pigmentation Disorders
summary: A new study has found that CBD may be effective in treating skin cancers and pigmentation disorders.

title: Anti-Flu Antibody Cocktail Could Change Virus Treatment
summary: A new anti-flu antibody cocktail may change the way viruses are treated.

title: Bacteria Found to Boost Chemotherapy Effectiveness
summary: A new study has found that certain types of bacteria can boost the effectiveness of chemotherapy, potentially leading to new treatments for cancer.

title: Epigenetics Links Maternal Infections & Neurodevelopmental Conditions
summary: There is increasing evidence linking maternal infections to developmental issues, and new research can explain how they are connected through epigenetics.

title: Study Explores Role of Cannabinoid Receptor Type 2 Activity in Granulocyte Colony-Stimulating Factor (G-CSF) Treatment for Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI)
summary: A study published in the Journal of Cannabis Research examined the effect of granulocyte colony-stimulating factor (G-CSF) treatment for traumatic brain injury (TBI).

title: Acetaminophen Under the Microscope: Evidence from Peer-Reviewed Studies
summary: Acetaminophen is a common pain and fever reliever medication used for many ailments, including headaches, muscle aches.

title: Exploration of Tumor-Immune Landscape in Colorectal Adenocarcinoma Using AI-Powered Multiplexed Image Analysis
summary: Colorectal cancer is a high disease burden cancer and is the second leading cause of cancer deaths worldwide.

title: Semaglutide Alters Taste of Sweet and Salty Foods
summary: Some people who take weight loss drug, semaglutide, report food tasting sweeter or saltier, something linked to lower appetite.

title: Apple-based Compound May Protect Against Periodontal Disease
summary: A natural compound extracted from apples, fig peels, and guava leaves has shown promise against bacteria that cause periodontal disease.

title: Side Effects of GLP-1 Weight Loss Drugs Include Many Possible Benefits
summary: Obesity is a public health problem that can increase an individual's risk of many other disorders.

title: High-intensity Interval Exercise and Hippocampal Health in Adults with Cannabis Use Disorder
summary: A clinical trial published in JAMA Psychiatry examined the effects of high-intensity interval training (HIIT) on hippocampal health in adults with cannabis use disorder.

title: Utah medical cannabis patients using illegal products
summary: A new study has found that some medical cannabis patients in Utah are using illegal products, highlighting the need for greater regulation and education in this area.
